intro: Streptachne, commonly known as false panicgrass, is a genus of grasses belonging to the family Poaceae. These plants are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and are characterized by their slender, often tufted growth habit. Streptachne species typically have narrow leaves and produce small, spikelet-based inflorescences. They are often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Botanically, they are of interest for their ecological roles and potential uses in agriculture and conservation.
